doc:
Peter Leeds https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Leeds 0 Peter Leeds (May 30, 1917 – November 12, 1996) was an American actor, who appeared on television more than 8,000 times and also had many film, Broadway, and radio credits. The majority of his work took place in the 1950s and 1960s. Working with many well-known comedians, he became popular as a straight man to their antics. Beyond situation comedies, Peter Leeds was also a dramatic actor, a Broadway performer, and a regular on many variety shows. He made three guest appearances on Perry Mason. Peter Leeds was also a popular voice-over artist, being heard on over 3,000 radio shows. Peter_Leeds ( May_30_,_1917 – November_12_,_1996 ) was an_American_actor , who appeared on television more_than_8,000_times and also_had many_film , Broadway , and radio_credits . The_majority of his_work took place in the_1950s_and_1960s . Working with many_well-known_comedians , he became popular as a_straight_man to their_antics . Beyond situation_comedies , Peter_Leeds was also a_dramatic_actor , a_Broadway_performer , and a_regular on many_variety_shows . He made three_guest_appearances on Perry_Mason . Peter_Leeds was also a_popular_voice-over_artist , being_heard on over_3,000_radio_shows .
